title: Roy Bell (politician)

sentences.sentence: Roy Mackenzie Bell (20 March 1885 – 20 August 1953) was a member of the Queensland Legislative Assembly
Bell was born at Denman, New South Wales, the son of Federick Samuel Bell and his wife Mary Charlotte  (née Mackenzie)
He was educated at The King's School, Parramatta and owned or managed a series of Stations in Queensland and New South Wales
On 22 July 1915 he married Annie Agnes Herbert (died 1964) in Singleton and together had two sons and one daughter
He died in Brisbane in August 1953 and his funeral was held at St John's Church of England Cathedral, Brisbane with his body then taken to Sydney for burial
Bell was an executive councilor on the Esk Shire Council and then in 1933 he won the by-election for the seat of Stanley, following the death of Ernest Grimstone
He held the seat until the 1938 state election when he retired from politics

main_sentence_from_spike: He was educated at The King 's School , Parramatta and owned or managed a series of Stations in Queensland and New South Wales .
